caption: This image features an abstract close-up view of what appears to be an underwater scene, though it could also be a microscopic shot of organic material. The focus is on a tangle of translucent, sinuous threads that resemble plant roots or neural fibers. These threads are thin and delicate, weaving around each other against a blurred and somewhat hazy blue background. Some parts of the threads are coated with tiny granules or particles, possibly sand or microbial growth, giving it a slightly textured appearance. The backdrop adds depth, with darker blues merging into lighter shades, suggesting a fluid, aqueous environment or a shadowy microscopic field. The overall effect is both intricate and alien, evoking a sense of natural complexity and the minute details of biological structures.
title: Mold growing around lichen on the bark of a fallen alder. Photo taken on Green Mountain, Washington near Seattle, Washington. From the Environmental Protection Agency's Project DOCUMERICA collection, "In Praise of Forests". For additional images see fiche #s 209, 210, 211, 212, and 213. ENTHEOS. Winter, 1974.
